results.title: Schools of thought (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Focuses on the examples of Ansett Airlines and the Australian Taxation Office to look at contemporary management principles and theories that are often changed and integrated to suit the needs of companies in the 1990’s. This episode looks at different theories of the past and how they have been adapted for present day use.

results.title: Management: a fundamental question (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
This episode asks the complex question: what is management? Since there are many diverse management systems, this episode follows a day in the life of two very different managers - Tricia Caswell, Director of the Australian Conservation Foundation and Michael Bowman from Ford Australia. The Chief Executive Officer of the City of Melbourne, Elizabeth Proust, joins Kerry O’Brien in the studio.

results.title: Planning your career (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
In many organisations, preparation for people to assume management positions is often poor and unstructured. While people should undertake career planning, organisations should also encourage career development skills. This episode focuses on two case studies of cadet mangement programs operating at the ANZ Bank and Coles Myer.

results.title: Edge of the Cold

group_works.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
group_works.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES

group_siblings.title: The Year of the Kings
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Parer and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: The Year of the Kings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
The final program in this series traces a full year’s life cycle of the King Penguin. These birds have had to adapt to a harsh environment on Macquarie Island, and have developed a well-organised social structure.

group_siblings.title: The Dominant male
group_siblings.creator_credit: Robert Horne and ABC

results.title: The Dominant male
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
One of four films about Macquarie Island. In September giant elephant seals come to mate and pup. This program follows events at the largest harem on the island, with 1,500 cows and 50 males. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary, production and photography by David Parer.

results.title: Ocean Wanderers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
Second in a series on the wildlife of Macquarie Island. The film shows the life cycles of the Wandering Albatross, the Rockhopper Penguin, the Black Browed Albatross and the Grey Headed Albatross

results.title: Monetary policy: a macro-economic perspective
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Anita Forsyth and Country Education Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
This program, produced in association with the Bank Education Service, discusses many controversial issues surrounding the relationship between the volume of money and the level of economic activity. Two professors of Economics, the chief economist of the ANZ Bank and the economics editor of the ‘Age’ debate these issues.

results.title: Deregulation & monetary policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An examination of how monetary policy has operated in Australia in the 1980’s, presented by Richard Bluck of Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Covers how monetary policy operated in the old regulated financial sector and now under deregulation; review of major institutional and other changes; reasons for deregulation and its implications for macro-economic management of the Australian economy. Worksheets are included with the video.
